alert.note: Alert for Colorado; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 9:58AM CST until January 26 at 11:30AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Colorado River at Columbus affecting Colorado and Wharton Counties. For the Colorado River...including Columbus, Wharton, Bay City, Matagorda...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Colorado River at Columbus. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 39.0 feet, At levels above 39 feet moderate lowland flooding begins as water from Columbus routes to near 18 feet downstream near Eagle Lake and Garwood closing FM 950 with significant lowland flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Thursday the stage was 38.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 34.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CST Thursday was 38.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 11.9 feet late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 37.6 feet on 10/18/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Colorado River Columbus 34.0 38.0 Thu 9 am CST 30.1 22.2 15.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this eveninglate tonight at 400 AM CST.
